title: How To Increase Hand Eye Coordination
body: Often times in game I keep miss-clicking a lot. Is there any games or something that can improve it?

replies.body:
its not just about a mental or physical fitness thing. 

Its about how people learn. 

Most people couldn't teach this to you as the concept itself is the reason most don't know what it is they did... if that makes any sense...

Its like, if I have skill A I probably can't tell you about it because the consequence of having skill A is failure to understand skill A. 

I breathe air and am thus less likely to notice normal air.


on to the point

Could you describe to me how you go about driving a car? There's a follow up to this. 

Most people will answer, 

"I get muh keys and rev it up and then I back out of the park'n lot and go!"

but you've forgotten to turn your keys and you didn't even put the hand break back down. Can you even turn the key without your foot on the break anymore.. or was that the break, I forget sometimes. I never think about it. Anyways, the thing you want to do is reduce the amount of thought that goes into your actions. 

Something to think about, not thinking at all is how you get fast reflexes. A reflex is where the body reacts without the smarter part of the brain helping, your body basically sends a stimuli to your spine and then gets an instant response before your brain even gets a chance to process.

So you want to consolidate your thoughts and act without thinking or rather without needing to think.

to do this you need two things one for each. 

1. a well tuned output fit for you - output here defined as everything you do or put out
2. a shorter version of the thoughts you still have.

examine yourself and see what you can shorten then practice the shortcut

Ya either got it or ya don't.
I shouldve been born a Korean

There is several things you can do to improve it. Professional MMA fighters Train their reaction time with Lucid dreaming, However I advise fast paced games that force you to make split second choices. Dark souls PvP though, I'm not sure How the dark souls franchise is doing. Other then that CSGO and other shooters like Halo and Call of duty Will increase reaction time. Outside of that you can learn to spot champion movement which will give away what move they are about to use but, Mostly sound bits will tip you off first. as long as you recognize the sound dodging will be increased.

I played call of duty black ops 3 for a week strait and I am bobbing and weaving skill shots left and right. If you use call of duty, turn the sensitivity up slowly, As you play, your reflex's will adjust to the new speed increasing hand to eye coordination. Best of times you will Spell shield and not even have to worry about dodging worst of times you predict and juke the other way. Its quite handy.
